intro: Psychotria foliosa, commonly known as the "cup of joy" or "devil's weed," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental and medicinal uses. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is also notable for containing psychoactive alkaloids, such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which have been studied for their potential effects on human consciousness. Due to its chemical composition, it has been used in traditional spiritual practices and is sometimes cultivated for research purposes.
